author: RotoWire Staff
title: Bucks' Damian Lillard: Won't play Friday - CBSSports.com
text:
Share Share Video Link copied! Lillard is out for Friday's game versus the Cavaliers due to a right calf strain.
Lillard appears to have sustained a right calf injury during the NBA Cup Championship and will sit out Friday. AJ Green and Delon Wright are candidates to receive increased playing time in his absence. Lillard's next chance to suit up is Saturday's matchup with Washington.
More News Bucks' Damian Lillard: Drops 23 points in NBA Cup victory 2D ago • by RotoWire Staff Bucks' Damian Lillard: Playing in NBA Cup Final 2D ago • by RotoWire Staff Bucks' Damian Lillard: Listed as probable, says he'll play 3D ago • by RotoWire Staff Bucks' Damian Lillard: Misses practice Monday 3D ago • by RotoWire Staff Bucks' Damian Lillard: Nearly double-doubles 8D ago • by RotoWire Staff Bucks' Damian Lillard: Team-high 31 points Friday 13D ago • by RotoWire Staff Our Latest Fantasy Basketball Stories Fantasy: Defensive standouts Dan Bruno • 5 min read Week 9 Start/Sits Adam King • 5 min read Week 9 waiver wire Alex Rikleen • 7 min read Hot or not: Long range shooters Dan Bruno • 4 min read Week 8 Start/Sits Adam King • 5 min read Week 8 waiver wire Alex Rikleen • 9 min read

author: Ceris Hewlings
title: It’s time! The Imagine Cruising World Indoor Bowls Championships 2024 starts tomorrow
text:
It’s time! The Imagine Cruising World Indoor Bowls Championships 2024 starts tomorrow
All eyes will be on Potters Resorts in Hopton-on-Sea, Norfolk, from tomorrow (Friday) when it hosts the Imagine Cruising World Indoor Bowls Championships
Seventeen days of world-class action will be streamed into your home – if you’re not fortunate to be watching the matches in person, of course.
Last year, the mecca of bowls that is the five-star all-inclusive resort on the east coast created its own unique magical conclusion to the 2023 event when qualifiers Jamie Walker (pictured) and Jason Banks reached the final, with Northampton-born Walker edging home in the tightest of games 8-7, 7-7 to pick up the unique Langham Glass trophy and a prize purse of £50,000.
Now both in the World Bowls Tour’s Top 16 as a result of their success on the portable rink last January, Walker will be back to defend his title. He faces Scotland’s Iain McLean in the first round, who won the Glasgow IBC PBA qualifier.
Said Walker: “I am definitely looking forward to defending my title and getting back out on the portable rink at Potters. In fact, I’ve been looking forward to it since January to be honest.
“2023 has been a decent year winning the national fours indoors after Potters was a great way to round off the season. The world outdoors championships were held in Australia towards the end of the summer; it’s always great to play over in Oz. The competition is always very high and with the different elements over there, it’s a different challenge to what we experience in the northern hemisphere.
“I’ve been easing into the indoor season ok. I had a great run in the Scottish International Open reaching the final and finishing runner-up to Stewart Anderson. I plan on playing plenty of nationals and a few open singles tournaments in the build up which should make sure I’ve had enough time on the green before the championship is here.
“The event as a whole is a great experience. Potters Resorts is an amazing venue for these championships to be held at. It has everything. I’m looking forward to the banter off the green and hopefully some high quality games on it.”
Banks, will no doubt be keen to overturn the disappointment of losing in the final, has been drawn against Australian qualifier Blake Nairn who played in the Scottish International Open in November.
Another Aussie making his way across the big pond for the championships is Aron Sherriff who wins a place as a result of being the current World Bowls Indoor Championships singles winner. He talks to us ahead of his first round match against none other than five times winner of the event and current World Bowls Tour number one ranked player Paul Foster MBE. The only woman in the open singles is the USA’s Giulia Galio.
In the other competitions, defending ladies’ matchplay champion Katherine Rednall will be looking for her sixth title. Her opening match is against fellow England international team-mate and PBA qualifier Annalisa Dunham.
Annalisa is one of the new faces to the portable rink for the ladies’ matchplay, along with Wales’ Lauren Gowan, Ailsa Robertson from Scotland and Giulia Galio.
A new addition this year sees all the competitors in the matchplay play gain entry in the mixed pairs too.
In both pairs events – open and mixed – there’s a few new partnerships, including Jason Banks and Paul Foster, in the open pairs, and it would take a brave person to pick the winner as all pairings will no doubt fancy their chances of tasting success.
Greg Harlow and Nicky Brett’s quest to retain the open pairs starts against Northampton IBC PBA qualifier winners Paul Nicholls and Tim Stone, while mixed pairs holders Ceri Ann Glen and Stewart Anderson find themselves up against Annalisa Dunham and David Gourlay MBE. Sara Nicholls makes her debut as one of the first women to qualify in the open pairs and Sian Honnor speaks to her ahead of her appearance elsewhere in this feature, while John Rednall catches up with Scotland’s Darren Weir who has qualified in both the singles and Under 25 singles.
Will it be a hattrick of wins for Daniel Pool, winner of the Under 25 singles title in 2022 and 2023, or will Darren get his name on the honours board after being runner-up to Pool on those occasions?
Bumper crowds are again expected at Potters throughout the championships and World Bowls Tour are delighted to have Imagine Cruising back on board for their second year as the headline sponsor of the event.
Every match will be streamed live on the
World Bowls Tour’s Facebook page and YouTube channel at no cost. Important: Please be mindful of fraudulent activity on social media, particularly during the World Indoor Championships. The streaming is available free-of-charge and you should not make any payment or share personal data with anyone promoting live streaming links. Please only watch the live coverage via the official sources.
From Monday 15th to Sunday, January 21, coverage will be available through BBC on BBC 2 and Red Button.
The full daily schedule and draws can be found at the following links:
Check out Bowls International‘s January issue for a pull-out preview supplement, with interviews, fill-in draw and more.
Bowls International is the world’s most respected bowling magazine, available monthly in both digital and print formats.

author: 周维朕
title: 跳出题海，快到大鹏"浪"起来_深圳新闻网
text:
深圳新闻网2025年6月12日讯（记者 周维朕）致亲爱的同学们！高考的笔尖刚刚停歇，青春的旅程才正要开始。这里有份毕业季旅游攻略送给你，用一场赴山海的旅行致敬青春吧！
西涌国际暗夜社区：星辰大海的梦幻之约
西涌国际暗夜社区拥有绵长细腻的沙滩，沙质洁白如银，海水清澈湛蓝在这里，白天你可以与同学们尽情享受阳光沙滩。
晚上在星空主题民宿仰望星空，听着海浪的轻吟度过一个浪漫又惬意的夜晚。静卧在滨海之中的星辰，宛如坠落了凡间如此宁静又格外璀璨。伴着悠悠海风，定会赞叹宇宙之浩大，我们犹如这些小小的星辰。一般终有一日，会发出自己特有的光芒。6月至7月，你可以在西涌国际暗夜社区欣赏到夏季银河认识、寻找自己的生日星座。
东西涌穿越：勇敢者的山海挑战
对于热爱户外运动的同学们，东西涌穿越绝对是来大鹏不可错过的体验。沿着蜿蜒的海岸线前行，一侧是陡峭险峻的悬崖，一侧是波澜壮阔的大海，让人在徒步过程中倍感舒适。
沿途可以欣赏到大自然雕琢的奇特礁石，还有湛蓝的海水，登上山顶俯瞰着一望无际的大海，心中满是征服的喜悦。当你站在山巅，欣赏辽阔的美景，你会发现再大的困难也能被征服，加油吧少年！
杨梅坑鹿嘴：《美人鱼》同款浪漫圣地
因电影《美人鱼》而声名远扬的杨梅坑鹿嘴是一个充满梦幻色彩的地方，近5公里的鹿嘴步道碧海相连，徒步慢跑皆宜，累了可以在碧道的鹿角台小憩和远眺海景。
一路山海相伴，抬头是蓝天白云，耳畔是海风轻拂，随心行走于如画的沿海绿道，把过往留在这里，用心迎接更广阔的天地。漫步于山海间，感受海风拂面，出示准考证的同学们，还可以免费乘坐观光车哦。走到碧道尽头，可以在鹿嘴沙滩踏沙追浪，或漫步悬崖栈道探访神秘美人鱼洞。
桔钓沙：细腻沙滩与玻璃海的完美融合
桔钓沙，新晋人气宝藏沙滩，三面青山相拥，海湾绵延一公里，树影婆娑，海风轻柔。纵使阅“滩”无数，还是会为桔钓沙发出赞叹，建议选择天气好的时候去，海水会看起来更清澈，直接美成壁纸。
南澳月亮湾：渔船港湾的宁静之美
南澳月亮湾是知名的渔港风情景点，拥有一线海景来此游玩的同学们可以在海港路海鲜一条街品尝海鲜的美食。傍晚时分更是可以和夕阳来一场心灵约会，从观海平台遥望海贝湾在月亮湾广场的观景台看“最美日落”定格青春里的美妙时刻。
较场尾：文艺民宿与多彩夜生活的聚集地
较场尾算得上是老牌网红了，上过央视《晚间新闻》等栏目，也常在影视剧、综艺里做客，多家风格多样的民宿，是粤港澳大湾区著名的民宿小镇。和最好的朋友入住一间温馨的民宿，推开窗就能看到大海白天，在海边漫步，感受阳光沙滩。晚上，夜生活丰富多彩酒吧、餐厅热闹非凡。记得定好闹钟，与朝霞一同醒来，看温暖的橘色太阳从海面慢慢浮现。
溪涌海滨栈道：漫步海滨的惬意时光
溪涌海滨栈道沿着海岸线蜿蜒伸展，这个夏天不如和最好的朋友来大鹏溪涌体验一把海滨漫步计划，看海、徒步、骑行、打卡拍照，一面海风，一面海浪，不要太惬意。栈道沿途可以看到很多片渐变色玻璃海，整条观海栈道距离不算长，却穿山、入林、出海，有着十分丰富的景观，空中旋转栈道是全程最佳打卡点。
玫瑰海岸：爱情与美景的永恒见证
沿着溪涌海滨栈道来到玫瑰海岸，一起去看那蔚蓝大海，在细软的沙滩上留下青春足迹，让美好的过往放心里，迎接更广阔的天地。草坪撒野，野餐露营，将疲惫的身心交由大自然疗愈；亲近自然，枕卧星空，让这片浪漫的海承包你旅行的心动。
高考终章，亦是人生序幕心存热爱，奔赴下一场山海。这个夏天欢迎五湖四海的你们来大鹏玩！

author: PA News Agency
title: Power now restored to all homes in Scotland affected by Storm Gerrit | The Leader
text: All homes that lost power as Storm Gerrit lashed Scotland have now been reconnected, bosses at power firm SSEN have confirmed. The electricity provider said its teams had worked through “particularly challenging conditions” to restore supplies to more than 48,000 homes. A final push by staff saw the last properties without electricity reconnected by 11pm on Friday, with customers in parts of Aberdeenshire, Perthshire and The Great Glen area in the Highlands all now with power again. Andy Smith, SSEN distribution’s operations director, said the storm had brought “serious disruption” with gale force winds having reached recorded speeds of 86mph in Inverbervie, Aberdeenshire and 84mph in Lerwick, Shetland. Mr Smith said: “Storm Gerrit caused serious disruption across the north of Scotland, and I would like to say thank you to our customers for their patience while we worked through some particularly challenging conditions to reconnect them, as quickly and safely as possible. “I’m very proud of the work undertaken by SSEN’s operational teams, and for being out at all hours and in all weathers to find and fix the faults over the past few days. “I would also like to extend my gratitude to our contract partners and fellow network operators for how they supported our response.” SSEN is now encouraging customers who were left without power to apply for compensation, depending on how long they were without electricity for. Completion of work to restore electricity supplies comes ahead of the latest weather alert, with a yellow warning for rain and snow having been issued for much of Scotland on Saturday. As a result of that Network Rail Scotland said speed restrictions will be in place on the West Highland Lines from 10am today until 9am on Sunday. Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. [Read the rules here](/misc/comments)

text:

Women demonstrate "incredible resilience and strength". The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights said, cited by the Spanish agency EFE. author: VideoElephant
title: Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024
text: At the start of the new year, 22 states and 43 cities and counties are increasing the hourly minimum wage, benefiting nearly 10 million people. And that doesn't only affect workers at major fast food chains or retail outlets; it also includes people who work at small, locally-owned businesses. spotlight Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024 - VideoElephant - - [0](https://oanow.com/news/nation-world/government-politics/millions-of-u-s-workers-will-see-a-pay-increase-in-2024/article_44b1f0c3-d348-56da-8916-17b2f25c9a80.html?mode=comments) Related to this story Most Popular Authorities are investigating a Christmas Day swatting call at Republican Rep. author: Dave Pierce Union Leader Staff
title: New Hampshire residents hunker down in Florida during Hurricane Milton
text: The good thing about being from New Hampshire and getting caught in Hurricane Milton is many hearty folks from these parts have “transferable skills,” having survived blizzards, microbursts and wild thunderstorms. The bad thing is that Florida’s brand of natural disasters can be a tad more intense when you’re staring down a tropical cyclone raging toward the coast as a Category 5 a day before it makes landfall. Olivia Torres, 21, who grew up in Nashua and is now a senior at the University of Tampa, said she’s definitely getting the hang of it. “Since this is technically my third hurricane, I knew what I was going into, but the fact that it turned into a Category 5 had me a little bit worried,” Torres said. “Especially because where the University of Tampa is situated, it is in Flood Zone A. So out of everybody in Tampa, we were the first to be like, ‘Yeah, we need to go.’” Hurricane Milton weakened as it approached Tampa, making landfall as a Category 3 late Wednesday. Torres and her classmates had already bugged out of their on-campus housing by Tuesday morning. Torres’s 19-year-old brother, Jackson, is also a UT student. Their dad, Walt, came to get them on Monday night and take them to Kissimmee, where he and his wife, Gloria, recently moved. “Thankfully, there hasn’t been too much damage where I am,” Olivia Torres said. “I know some other places can’t say the same.” Although most of their family is still back in New England, Olivia Torres said she now feels like a battle-tested Floridian. “I definitely think after four years of living here, I’m an official Florida resident because when this hurricane came around, I was like, ‘All right, let’s go.’ I already had a plan in place,” she said. “It’s like you’re trading in your snow days for hurricane weeks, or ‘hurrication’ as they call it down here.” ‘Gator Aid’ From Tampa to Kissimmee to Gainesville, several New Hampshire residents were in Florida during the storm, which brought dangerous winds, heavy rain, flooding, storm surge and nearly 40 tornadoes. Five [logistics specialists from New Hampshire’s Army National Guard](https://www.unionleader.com/news/safety/new-hampshire-guard-races-to-florida-ahead-of-hurricane/article_bb9bc98c-84f5-11ef-9bbc-5beb4fedd2f4.html) settled into their weeklong mission Wednesday after arriving at the Robert F. Ensslin Jr. National Guard armory in Gainesville on Tuesday after 19 hours of driving. With an unofficial moniker of “Gator Aid,” the Granite Staters began their mission of managing convoys of supplies and personnel. Lt. Col. Greg Heilshorn, public affairs officer for the New Hampshire National Guard, provided an update on Facebook from the team Thursday after speaking on the phone with Capt. James Kelly, a logistics chief for Joint Force Headquarters. “We are providing breathing room for Florida as all this extra help flows into the state,” said Kelly, a Nashua resident. Kelly’s team is coordinating incoming support from the rest of the country, including 6,000 inbound guardsmen from 15 states, 22 helicopters, more than 500 high-water vehicles, and 13 boats, he said. As of noon Thursday, the team was tracking 35 separate movements and 1,400 guardsmen in transit. New Hampshire also sent Capt. Justin Moran, 1st Lt. Christopher Bruneau, Master Sgt. Bernard Hudgens and Sgt. 1st Class Scott Jones. Hudgens and Jones were among 500 New Hampshire guardsmen who deployed to New Orleans in 2005 in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina. “The group we have down here — everyone gets along,” Kelly said. “We are plugged in. We are working super hard. Morale is great.” New Hampshire [also deployed five members of its Homeland Security and Emergency Management team](https://www.unionleader.com/news/safety/new-hampshire-sends-more-aid-to-florida-for-life-threatening-hurricane-milton/article_626769e8-866c-11ef-bcc9-ef1f6dadc73f.html) to Florida on Wednesday. Lisa Carter, who lives in New Hampshire, has family in Lakeland, Florida. Her mother, stepfather and sister sheltered together. Carter’s mom, Diane Wilkes, moved to an upscale 55-plus mobile home community in Florida in 2016. Her sister, Tresa Carter, moved there from Delaware recently to be closer to their mom. Wilkes and her husband, Peter, stayed with Tresa Carter. “Everybody is doing great. I was just on the phone with them earlier today,” Lisa Carter said Thursday afternoon. Lakeland was spared from Milton’s full wrath, but Lisa Carter’s family lost power and there was some damage to the rental property Tresa Carter owns. The tornadoes did get pretty close to them in Lakeland though. “There were tornadoes along Interstate 4 going into Orlando. Mileage-wise, that was only about 10-15 miles from where my parents and my sister were,” she said. Lisa Carter runs a website called [letsmovetofla.com](https://www.letsmovetofla.com), which helps people from other states learn everything they can about moving to Florida. Through the website and social media, she ended up helping direct first-timers to the resources they needed on the ground during the hurricane. “There’s so much you don’t know before you get down there,” she said.

author: Amaris Encinas
title: What does 12/31/23 mean? The last day of 2023 is an angel number
text:
The upcoming year will be filled with blessings, at least that is what the numerical sequence of this New Year’s Eve date suggests.
If you take a closer look at the date, written as 12/31/23 or even 123123, you might see an angel number, which are repeating number sequence s, often used as a guide for deeper spiritual exploration. The numerical sequences can range anywhere from 000 to 999 , with each number having a distinct meaning and energy, USA Today previously reported.
The once-in-a-century date, which won’t be seen again on our calenders until Dec. 31, 2123, marks a new beginning. One, that asks us to “transform and evolve with the times and in the right place to embrace what is coming to us,” according to the Old Farmer’s Almanac website.
The date has also sparked an online trend, with TikTok users creating videos on the significance of the number and merchandise commemorating the date selling online, including on platforms like Amazon , eBay and Etsy , the Detroit Free Press, part of the USA Today Network reported.
Here’s what we know about the date.
What does 12/31/23 signify within numerology? Numerology is an ancient esoteric science that deals with numbers and letters and the energy, intention and vibration behind them, professional numerologist Novalee Wilder shared with USA Today earlier this month.
"Before there was even language, there were numbers," she said. "Before we had named things, we had counted them, and we had assigned meaning to that count."
The numbers that make up the angel number are just as important as the whole number, especially when you are trying to determine the vibration and intention behind the number.
Professional astrologer Narayana Montúfar told Farmer’s Almanac that the “Number 1 brings the very spark of initiation, 2 focuses on building, and 3 is related to the concept of creation. Together, the sequence of these three numbers speaks of the spark of initiation that seeks to build a new creation.”
If you add all the numbers that make up the date 123123 together, you will come up with 12.
The number 12 in numerology can symbolize spiritual enlightenment, with potential for the day to deliver epiphanies and “aha” moments for individuals and society at large, the website stated.
FYI: How to keep your pets calm during New Year's Eve fireworks
What are some dates to keep in mind in 2024? If you are an angel number enthusiast, there are a few key dates you might want to keep in mind as 2024 rapidly approaches.
A palindrome, not unlike an angel number, is a term typically reserved for words or phrases that are spelled the same way backward as they are forward. Words like level, kayak, civic, and radar are among some of the most common palindromes, according to the Old Farmer’s Almanac.
Numerical sequences seen in dates or times can also be palindromes, the most well-recognized ones being 3/20/23 or 11:11 , the website stated.
Here are all palindrome dates that will occur in 2024, courtesy of the Farmer’s Almanac :
4/2/24 4/20/24 4/21/24 4/22/24 4/23/24 4/24/24 4/25/24 4/26/24 4/27/24 4/28/24 4/29/24 Contributing: Olivia Munson, USA Today
30 famous Capricorns you should know: These celebrities belong to the winter Zodiac sign
